module.name: Accra counter
module.description: With this VSCP module it is possible to count on four channels.

picture.description: Picture of the Accra counter module.

firmware.description: Firmware version 1.0.0 for the Accra counter module. Relocated firmware for use with boot loader.
Firmware version 1.0.0 for the Accra counter module. Firmware for standalone use.

manual.description: Full manual for the Beijing module.

module.registers:
Zone Zone this module belongs to rw
Sub zone Sub zone this module belongs to rw
Sub zone counter 0 Sub zone for counter channel 0 rw
Sub zone counter 1 Sub zone for counter channel 1 rw
Sub zone counter 2 Sub zone for counter channel 2 rw
Sub zone counter 3 Sub zone for counter channel 3 rw
Counter 0 status register
Status register for counter 0 Functionality for counter 0.\n\n Bit 7 - Enable counter.\n Bit 6 - Reserved.\n Bit 5 - Enable frequency high alarm.\n Bit 4 - Enable frequency low alarm.\n Bit 3 - Reload value on overflow.\n Bit 2 - Reload value on zero.\n Bit 1 - Enable alarm level.\n Bit 0 - Direction.\n
rw
Direction Counting direction. 0=count upwards. 1=count down.
Enable counter alarm Enable alarm level for counter..
Enable zero reload value Enable reload value on zero
Enable overflow reload value Enable reload value on overflow.
Enable frequency low alarm Enable frequency low alarm.
Enable frequency high alarm Enable frequency high alarm.
Reserved Reserved.
Enable counter The counter will start to count.
Counter 1 status register
Status register for counter 1 Functionality for counter 1.\n\n Bit 7 - Enable counter.\n Bit 6 - Reserved.\n Bit 5 - Reserved.\n Bit 4 - Reserved.\n Bit 3 - Reserved.\n Bit 2 - Reserved.\n Bit 1 - Reserved.\n Bit 0 - Reserved.\n
rw
Reserved Reserved.
Reserved Reserved.
Reserved Reserved.
Reserved Reserved.
Reserved Reserved.
Reserved Reserved.
Reserved Reserved.
Enable counter The counter will start to count.
Counter 2 status register
Status register for counter 2 Functionality for counter 2.\n\n Bit 7 - Enable counter.\n Bit 6 - Reserved.\n Bit 5 - Reserved.\n Bit 4 - Reserved.\n Bit 3 - Reserved.\n Bit 2 - Reserved.\n Bit 1 - Reserved.\n Bit 0 - Reserved.\n
rw
Reserved Reserved.
Reserved Reserved.
Reserved Reserved.
Reserved Reserved.
Reserved Reserved.
Reserved Reserved.
Reserved Reserved.
Enable counter The counter will start to count.
Counter 3 status register
Status register for counter 3 Functionality for counter 3.\n\n Bit 7 - Enable counter.\n Bit 6 - Reserved.\n Bit 5 - Reserved.\n Bit 4 - Reserved.\n Bit 3 - Reserved.\n Bit 2 - Reserved.\n Bit 1 - Reserved.\n Bit 0 - Reserved.\n
rw
Reserved Reserved.

Reserved Reserved.
Reserved Reserved.
Enable counter The counter will start to count.
Frequency 0 status register
Status register for frequency 0 Functionality for frequency 0.\n\n Bit 7 - Enable frequency measurements.\n Bit 6 - Reserved.\n Bit 5 - Reserved.\n Bit 4 - Reserved.\n Bit 3 - Reserved.\n Bit 2 - Reserved.\n Bit 1 - Enable frequency high alarm.\n Bit 0 - Enable frequency low alarm.\n
rw
Low alarm Enable frequency low alarm.
High alarm Enable frequency high alarm.
Enable zero reload value Enable reload value on zero
Reserved Reserved.
Reserved Reserved.
Reserved Reserved.
Reserved Reserved.
Enable frequency measurements Enable frequency measurements.
Frequency 1 status register

Reset counter 0 Reset counter 0 by writing any value to this register. Will always read as zero.
rw
Reset counter 1 Reset counter 1 by writing any value to this register. Will always read as zero.

abstraction.name: Frequency channel 0
abstraction.description: A 24-bit floating point frequency for channel 0.\n

abstraction.name: Frequency channel 1
abstraction.description: A 24-bit floating point frequency for channel 1.\n

abstraction.name: Frequency channel 2
abstraction.description: A 24-bit floating point frequency for channel 2.\n

abstraction.name: Frequency channel 3
abstraction.description: A 24-bit floating point frequency for channel 3.\n

abstraction.name: k-constant channel 0
abstraction.description: A 24-bit floating point k-constant for linearisation of channel 0.\n

abstraction.name: k-constant channel 1
abstraction.description: A 24-bit floating point k-constant for linearisation of channel 1.\n

abstraction.name: k-constant channel 2
abstraction.description: A 24-bit floating point k-constant for linearisation of channel 2.\n

abstraction.name: k-constant channel 3
abstraction.description: A 24-bit floating point k-constant for linearisation of channel 3.\n

abstraction.name: m-constant channel 0
abstraction.description: A 24-bit floating point m-constant for linearisation of channel 0.\n

abstraction.name: m-constant channel 1
abstraction.description: A 24-bit floating point m-constant for linearisation of channel 1.\n

abstraction.name: m-constant channel 2
abstraction.description: A 24-bit floating point m-constant for linearisation of channel 2.\n

abstraction.name: m-constant channel 3
abstraction.description: A 24-bit floating point m-constant for linearisation of channel 3.\n

bit.name: Alarm frequency 3
bit.description: Frequency alarm channel 3. The frequency is higher/lower then a limit value..

bit.name: Alarm frequency 2
bit.description: Frequency alarm channel 2. The frequency is higher/lower then a limit value.

bit.name: Alarm frequency 1
bit.description: Frequency alarm channel 1. The frequency is higher/lower then a limit value.

bit.name: Alarm frequency 0
bit.description: Frequency alarm channel 0. The frequency is higher/lower then a limit value.

bit.name: Alarm counter 3
bit.description: Counter alarm channel 3. The counter has passed a limit value.

bit.name: Alarm counter 2
bit.description: Counter alarm channel 2. The counter has passed a limit value.

bit.name: Alarm counter 1
bit.description: Counter alarm channel 1. The counter has passed a limit value.

bit.name: Alarm counter 0
bit.description: Counter alarm channel 0. The counter has passed a limit value.

action.name: Set output of I/O channel high
action.description: Set the output of the I/O channel given by the argument to its high state. The argument is an integer where 0 is output 0 and so on and can be in the range 0-9.\n

param.name: Channel to set state high on
param.description: Integer representing I/O channel to set state high on.

action.name: Set output of I/O channel low
action.description: Set the output of the I/O channel given by the argument to its low state. The argument is an integer where 0 is output 0 and so on and can be in the range 0-9.\n

param.name: Channel to set state low on
param.description: Integer representing I/O channel to set state low on.

action.name: Turn on pulse on output I/O channel
action.description: Turn on pulse output on the output I/O channel given by the argument. The argument is an integer where 0 is output 0 and so on and can be in the range 0-9. Does not have any meaning for a channel set as input.\n

param.name: Channel to activate pulse output on.
param.description: Integer representing I/O channel to pulse.

action.name: Turn off pulse on output I/O channel
action.description: Turn off pulse output on the output I/O channel given by the argument. The argument is an integer where 0 is output 0 and so on and can be in the range 0-9. Does not have any meaning for a channel set as input.\n

param.name: Channel to activate pulse output on.
param.description: Integer representing I/O channel to pulse.

action.name: Toggle output for channel
action.description: Toggle output four output I/O channel given by argument. The argument is an integer where 0 is output 0 and so on and can be in the range 0-9. Does not have any meaning for a channel set as input.\n

param.name: Output I/O channel to toggle
param.description: Integer representing output I/O channel to toggle.

action.name: Send status for I/O channel
action.description: Send status for an I/O channel given by the argument. The argument is an integer where 0 is output 0 and so on and can be in the range 0-9.\n For a channel set as output the status is the output applied and for a channel set as input the actual input state.

param.name: Channel to send status for
param.description: Integer representing the I/O channel to send status for.

action.name: Send status for all I/O channels.
action.description: Send status for all I/O channels starting with channel 0 and then taking each channel up to channel 9.

event.name: On Event
event.description: An I/O channel has been set to its ON position. For an output this means that it has been set high. For a channel set as an input it means the channel input turned high. The channel is checked every second for a change.

data.name: Zone
data.description: Is set to the zone for the module.

data.name: Sub zone
data.description: Is set to the sub zone for the channel.

event.name: Off Event
event.description: An I/O channel has been set to its OFF position. For an output this means that it has been set low. For a channel set as an input it means the channel input turned low. The channel is checked every second for a change.

data.name: Zone
data.description: Is set to the zone for the module.

data.name: Sub zone
data.description: Is set to the sub zone for the channel.

event.name: TurnOn Event
event.description: An I/O channel has been set to its ON position. The channel is checked every second for a change. This is only valid for a channel configured as input.

data.name: Zone
data.description: Is set to the zone for the module.

data.name: Sub zone
data.description: Is set to the sub zone for the channel.

event.name: TurnOff Event
event.description: An I/O channel has been set to its OFF position. The channel is checked every second for a change. This is only valid for a channel configured as input.

data.name: Zone
data.description: Is set to the zone for the module.

data.name: Sub zone
data.description: Is set to the sub zone for the channel.

event.name: I/O Data event
event.description: Input/Output data steam event sent on regular intervals if activated.

data.name: Data coding
data.description: Set to zero for bit coding, unit=0, sensor=0.

data.name: Outputs states
data.description: State for outputs. Bit 0 is output 0 and so on.

data.name: Input states
data.description: State for inputs. Bit 0 is input 0 and so on.

event.name: I/O alarm event
event.description: If an alarm is armed this event is sent when it occurs and the corresponding alarm bit is set in the alarm register.

data.name: Sub zone
data.description: Sub zone for channel or sub zone for module if channel sub zone is zero.

recipe.name: Blink channel 0
recipe.description: Set channel 0 to output and blink with 10 Hz.

messagebox.head: Beijing I/O node
messagebox.description: With what frequency should channel blink?
